title: reset passwords
content: I haven’t used Firefox in years. Recently, I got a new Mac M mini with the M4 chip and I’m trying to use Firefox as my primary browser because many websites don’t seem to work with Safari. Now, I’m facing a big dilemma. I don’t remember the password for Firefox from the past. It doesn’t seem to remember it, and I can’t change it. Every time I try to use Firefox, it keeps asking for this password. Can you please help me reset the password and set up a Firefox account that works seamlessly with my fingerprint as a password? If this is not possible, I’ll have to choose not to use the service.
creator: netgear9500

title: Delete cookies from specified time period
content: Hi, I have Mozilla Firefox for Windows. How do I do if I want to delete cookies from the past week? The clear history option only seems to have last hour, last two hours, last four hours, since midnight and "All history". I have a website that doesn't work that I suspect doesn't work due to a cookie issue (as it is a website that I have visited with other browsers and whenever I get the behaviour I just clear the cookies from the past visit and it starts working). I therefore need to remove cookies from the past week (or some other time period that I can specify myself), because only since midnight won't do and I do not want to remove all cookies since I got Firefox. Selectively removing cookies from one specific site is not an option etiher, unless I can remove them from the past week, as I don't want to remove older cookies from that site.

title: Left mouse button creates a PASTE popup in LINUX and WINDOWS firefox
content: I am a user of Tryahackme.com. Within THM you work with the website on the leftside of the browser, on the rightside you get an attackbox, normally a windows or linux machine. Ever since the latest update of firefox an annoying error was introduced, as soon if I hover over the attackbox it continiously creates an "PASTE"-option , even if I haven't copied something. It appears as soon as I hit my left mouse button. It actually creates an unworkable situation as the "PASTE"-option doesn't go away. I checked from an linux machine with the latest firefox and the error appears as well. I checked with Chrome and Edge, no error.
